name: Overgrown (Peyton Rodgers)
description:
In a world where everything has been overtaken by nature, a young mouse named Eiasi finds himself lost. He needs to find his sister Twamme so that together they can return to their grandfather's house.

Overgrown is a five level puzzle game that requires the player to navigate both Eiasi and Twamme through their journey, often at the same time.

FEATURES
❃ Explore a world of nature on the mouse siblings' journey home
❃ Call Twamme into the scene and problem solve to guide two characters at once
❃ Navigate through mazes and mirrored platforms
❃ Experience different times of day
❃ Trees, mazes, and mice, oh my!

CREDITS
The title screen art, font for the game, and text boxes were all custom made. The rest of the 3D art assets were found on the Unity Asset Store. All of the asset packs used in the game are listed below, and royalty free music was found on YouTube and made by some really cool indie artists. A big thanks to all of the artists that put their beautiful work out there for free use!
   3D Assets:
❃ Mouse Knight PBR Polyart by Dungeon Mason
❃ Baker's House by Evgenia
❃ Free Low Poly Nature Project Pack 1 Meadows by EmacEArt 
❃ Low Poly Nature - FREE Vegetation by Elcanetay
❃ Low Poly Pack by Andrey Graphics
❃ Fantasy Lands - Free mini pack by Tarko 3D 
❃ Free Small Low Poly Pack by B&J Studio 
❃ Hand-Painted Fountain by Peter Schuster
❃ Medieval Low-Poly Carts Free by 256px
❃ Fancy Tavern by NIX Solutions
❃ Polygonal's Low-Poly Particle Pack by Polygonal Stuff
❃ Farland Skies - Cloudy Crown by Borodar
❃ Polarized Platform Pack by Polygonetic
❃ Cartoon FX Free by Jean Moreno (JMO)
   Music:
❃ Kori - Bloom
❃ Nomyn - The Journey
❃ Wiljan & Xandra - Woodlands
❃ Lucas D. - Rainy Day
❃ Gate x Duumu - Sunset From My Desk
❃ Andy Leech - Dawn
Code for the game’s mechanics was provided by the University of Texas at Austin’s AET 318 program, with instruction given by David Cohen. A huge thanks to him!
